com.zpaper.commons.utils

Class Utils

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.zpaper.commons.utils.Utils

  • public final class Utils
extends Object
    General purpose utilities for Zippi.File

    The zPaper dbID returned by newID(int, String) and helpers is defined as follows:

    <User ID><Uniquer><Timestamp> Where:
    User ID
    An 8 character hexadecimal string representing the of a userID padded with leading '0' characters
    Uniquer
    A single character which assists in the conflict avoidance by server/services location.
    Current convention
    LetterLocation
    Akb_config.props on the "a" server
    Bkb_config.props on the "b" server
    Ckb_config.props on the "c" server
    Dkb_config.props on the "d" server
    Jmyfileforce_config.props on the "a" server
    Kmyfileforce_config.props on the "b" server
    Lmyfileforce_config.props on the "c" server
    Mmyfileforce_config.props on the "d" server
    Timestamp
    A 9 character base32 representation of the number of milliseconds since the epoch (Jan 1, 1970) padded with leading '0' characters.

      • mapToStringArray

        public static String[][] mapToStringArray(Map map)
        Returns an array of String arrays containing Name/Value pairs. The first element in the sub-array is the name: e.g. map[x][0]. The second element in the sub-aray is the value: e.g. map[x][1].
        Parameters:
        map - the Map to expand
        Returns:
        an array of String arrays containing Name/Value pairs.

                           String dbIDNamespace)
        Returns a string representing a zPaper dbID
        Parameters:

        dbIDNamespace - A single character to uniquely identify originating server and component (Defaults to 'X').

        a string representing a zPaper dbID
        See Also:
        zPaper dbID

        public static String newID(String userNumber,
                           String dbIDNamespace)
        Returns a string representing a zPaper dbID
        Parameters:
        userNumber - the user number to be incorporated into the new ID
        dbIDNamespace - a "uniquer" character to avoid collisions from multiple webapps and servers updating the same db.
        Returns:
        a string representing a zPaper dbID
        See Also:
        newID(int, String)

      • moveFile

        public static boolean moveFile(File fromFile,
                               File toDir)
                        throws IOException
        Moves the file referenced by fromFile to the directory referenced by toDir. The directory will be created if necessary. Two methods are used to move the file: 1. Rename is attempted, if not successful -> 2. Move by streams. If there is a file with the same name in the destination it will be deleted prior to the move.
        Parameters:
        fromFile - the file to move
        toDir - the directory in which to move the file
        Returns:
        true if successful
        Throws:
        IOException - on IO failure

      • copyFile

        public static void copyFile(File fromFile,
                            File toFile,
                            boolean append)
                     throws IOException
        Copies a file from one location to another via streams.
        Parameters:
        fromFile - the source file
        toFile - the destination file
        append - if true, append bytes to the destination file.
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs during the operation

      • myToHex

        public static String myToHex(int value,
                             int width)
        Returns a hex string value of the specified width. WARNING While this method pads with leading zeros, it will truncate the least significant digits if the value string is greater than the specified width.
        Parameters:
        value - the Integer value to encode
        width - the maximum width of the returned String
        Returns:
        a hex string value of the specified width

        public static Map<String,String> parseQueryString(String qs)
        Deprecated. Makes use of URLDecoder which is not appropriate for query strings
        Parses a queryString and returns a key/value map of single value parameters (last param wins) TODO Correctly use a URI decoder
        Parameters:
        qs - the http query string to parse
        Returns:
        a Map<String, String> of name to value strings.

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        a Collection<Integer> corresponding to the pages expression. Returns an empty Collection<Integer> if pages is null or unparsable

      • encryptedPdfPassword

        public static byte[] encryptedPdfPassword(String plainText)
        Returns a cipherText byte array suitable for use as a PDF password. If the pdfFile is not a valid AllFiles type of file then it returns null
        Parameters:
        plainText - The plainText value to encrypt
        Returns:
        Returns a cipherText byte array suitable for use as the PDF password or null if not encryptable.

      • encryptPdfPassword

        public static byte[] encryptPdfPassword(File pdfFile)
        Returns a cipherText byte array suitable for use as the PDF password. If the pdfFile is not a valid AllFiles type of file then it returns null
        Parameters:
        pdfFile - The file to encrypt
        Returns:
        Returns a cipherText byte array suitable for use as the PDF password or null if not encryptable.

      • quoteJSON

        public static String quoteJSON(String string)
        Produce a string in double quotes with backslash sequences in all the right places. A backslash will be inserted within </, producing <\/, allowing JSON text to be delivered in HTML. In JSON text, a string cannot contain a control character or an unescaped quote or backslash.
        Parameters:
        string - A String
        Returns:
        A String correctly formatted for insertion in a JSON text.

      • encodeURIComponent

        public static String encodeURIComponent(String s)
        Creates a percent encoded string. The original string is extracted using the UTF-8 codeset. We may NOT use URLEncoder.encode(param[0], "UTF-8") because it converts (' ' to '+')
        Parameters:
        s - the original String
        Returns:
        a URI encoded String
        See Also:
        https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3986

      • normalizeTemplateJSStrings

        public static String normalizeTemplateJSStrings(String jsExpression)
        KBS-26 #comment ensure that syntactically incorrect JS strings are corrected prior to parsing This function exists initially to replace newlines in javascript expressions with proper escape sequence. This is to accommodate java script expressions within the template fields of zPaper which are poorly written. Extended scope to include proper processing of singal and multi-line comments
        Parameters:
        jsExpression - the Javascript expression
        Returns:
        the normalized jsExpression
